messages.message: We spent ages trying to solve Company Beneficial Ownership Charts for a customer in a POV earlier this year. I've just solved it in 15 minutes on AIHub :exploding_head:
@Ruchel this would be very interesting for Citi Wealth
@Mark awesome example, thanks for sharing! Can you share the sample document?

And the prompt:
Each box represents a company. Arrows pointing from one box to another denotes ownership of a company. Multiple companies can own shares in a company. If a company does not have an arrow pointing to it from another company, then it does not have any owners. With this context, build a recursive list of all the owners of KYB PTY LTD and the owners of these owners, as JSON, including company name, whether it is a private company, trust or beneficial owner, and the percentage the company owns
@Shubham @avi Great use case that we could build an app for. Also the doc can be generic / synthetic here

Looks good indeed
nit: model doesn’t see arrows at all - but it’s trying to infer the relationship based on the “Owner” text in between the text boxes
@Mark Is this image available in an editable format
would love to experiment on it a little
@Dan H this might actually be really interesting to show Mihir next Friday too
Unfortunately not @Piyush. Will see if I can get access to some samples though
How are we embedding the arrows?  With the single-modal models, I’d imagine we need to embed that as text somehow.
Id imagine that the model gets confused on arrows from owner E to z trust vs an arrow going from D to C
